intro: Odontites vernus subsp. serotinus, commonly known as the late-flowering toothwort, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and has a short, hairy stem with palmate leaves. Its flowers, which appear later in the growing season, are small and white, arranged in umbrella-like clusters. The subspecies is distinguished by its delayed flowering and specific habitat preferences compared to other members of the species.
